exercises.name: Squat
exercises.description: A fundamental exercise for building strength in your legs and core. It works your quads, hamstrings, and glutes.
steps_to_follow: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Bend your knees and push your hips back as if sitting in a chair.
Keep your chest up and your back straight as you lower yourself.
Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground or deeper if possible.
Push through your heels to return to the standing position.

exercises.name: Deadlift
exercises.description: A strength training exercise that targets the back, glutes, and hamstrings. It is essential for overall body strength.
steps_to_follow: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell in front of your shins.
Bend your knees slightly and grasp the barbell with your hands just outside your legs.
Keep your chest up and back straight as you lift the bar by pushing through your heels.
Once the bar passes your knees, thrust your hips forward to stand up straight.
Lower the bar back down by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.

food_plan.description: A lean source of protein that is essential for muscle growth.

food_plan.name: Brown Rice
food_plan.description: A slow-digesting carb that provides sustained energy for workouts.

food_plan.name: Sweet Potatoes
food_plan.description: Rich in vitamins and complex carbs, great for fueling workouts.

exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
exercises.description: A cardiovascular exercise that helps in burning fat and improving endurance.
steps_to_follow: Stand with your feet together and arms by your sides.
Jump and spread your legs while raising your arms above your head.
Jump back to the starting position and repeat at a steady pace.

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.description: A full-body workout that helps in burning calories and strengthening the core.
steps_to_follow: Start in a push-up position, hands under your shoulders.
Bring one knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs, as if running in place.
Continue alternating legs as quickly as possible, maintaining a steady rhythm.

food_plan.name: Leafy Greens
food_plan.description: Low in calories and high in nutrients, perfect for a weight loss diet.

food_plan.name: Grilled Salmon
food_plan.description: Rich in healthy fats and protein, it helps maintain muscle while losing fat.

food_plan.name: Cucumber
food_plan.description: Low in calories, helps with hydration, and keeps you full longer.

exercises.name: Push-Ups
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise that works the chest, shoulders, and triceps while also engaging the core.
steps_to_follow: Start in a plank position, hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows.
Keep your back straight and chest lifted as you push back up to the starting position.

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.description: A lower-body exercise that targets your quads, hamstrings, and glutes.
steps_to_follow: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Take a large step forward with one leg and lower your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.
Push off the front foot to return to the standing position.
Repeat on the other side.

food_plan.description: A lean source of protein, perfect for muscle recovery and endurance.

food_plan.description: A slow-digesting carb that provides steady energy throughout the day.

food_plan.name: Spinach
food_plan.description: Low in calories and packed with vitamins and minerals for overall health.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.description: A core-strengthening exercise that helps maintain balance and stability.
steps_to_follow: Start in a push-up position with your forearms on the ground.
Engage your core, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Hold the position as long as possible, maintaining proper form.

exercises.name: Bicycle Crunches
exercises.description: An exercise that works the abs and obliques, improving core strength and endurance.
steps_to_follow: Lie on your back with your knees bent and hands behind your head.
Bring one knee towards your chest while twisting your torso to bring the opposite elbow towards that knee.
Switch sides by extending the first leg and bringing the other knee in.

food_plan.name: Quinoa
food_plan.description: A whole grain that's rich in protein, fiber, and essential amino acids.

food_plan.name: Grilled Salmon
food_plan.description: A healthy protein source, rich in omega-3 fatty acids for heart health.

food_plan.name: Greek Yogurt
food_plan.description: A high-protein dairy product that aids in digestion and muscle recovery.

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.description: A foundational upper-body exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
steps_to_follow: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the ground.
Grasp the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lower the barbell to your chest while keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position.

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.description: A great exercise for building shoulder and arm strength.
steps_to_follow: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell or dumbbells at shoulder height.
Press the weights overhead, fully extending your arms.
Lower the weights back down to shoulder height and repeat.

food_plan.description: A rich source of protein and iron, essential for building strength.

food_plan.name: Cottage Cheese

exercises.name: Running
exercises.description: A great cardiovascular workout that improves endurance and helps with weight loss.
steps_to_follow: Warm-up with light jogging for 5 minutes.
Start at a comfortable pace, gradually increasing your speed.
Maintain a consistent pace and keep proper form.
Cool down with a slow jog or walk for 5 minutes.

exercises.name: Cycling
exercises.description: An excellent low-impact cardiovascular workout that burns calories.
steps_to_follow: Adjust your bike to fit your height and ensure the seat is at the correct level.
Start at a moderate pace, gradually increasing your speed and resistance.
Keep your back straight and use your legs efficiently.
Cool down with a slow pace for 5 minutes.
